page.title: 08LITTLE HOUGHTON ..20th Cent.
page.content: In agricultural terms at least very little appears to have changed in the last 86 years. However{Little Houghton}has one important claim to fame. In 1937 a French company was looking for a U.K. base; the old watermill nestling by the Nene seemed ideal for the manufacture of{gelatine.}After all there was abundant water and clean air. Unfortunately the works closed in 1980 and the building is now being demolished. Not far away 2 acres of glass deflect the sun's rays onto {cacti}being prepared for the wholesale market. In 1979 over{50 years of campaigning reached a successful conclusion when the by-pass was built;{2 miles long}at a cost of{Â£1,500,000.}The road has cut vehicles from{6000 each day to 60}and clocks no longer fall to the floor.
